example.text: I won't let Kevin McCarthy and his Big Oil cronies hold our climate hostage in their debt ceiling game. We can't throw away clean jobs, climate justice, and emission reductions for fast-tracked fossil fuel failures. [[url]]

That is why, 1 year ago, I filed the Right to Contraception Act with my colleagues Senators Duckworth, Hirono, Baldwin, and Murray, and I stood here, much like I am today, to request unanimous consent to pass our legislation. The House of Representatives passed the bill by a bipartisan vote of 220 to 195 at that time.

I'm live in Pittsfield to celebrate federal funding for the Berkshire Family YMCA so that we can create jobs and expand local child care & recreation opportunities as we build a resilient downtown. Join us: [[url]]
Mr. President, go outside. It is hard to breathe.

The public health emergency may be coming to an end, but COVID-19 remains a daily specter for disabled, immunocompromised, and elderly Americans. We can and must keep taking effective steps to contain the spread of COVID such as masking, continued vaccination, and testing.

As the G7 meets in Hiroshima, we must not forget the US was the first country to use nuclear weapons. Today, we should lead by example and focus on saving the planet—not ending it. That's why I'm reintroducing my SANE Act with [[user]] to stop wasteful nuclear spending.

Nobody—including children and pregnant people—should suffer the impacts of air pollution, extreme heat, and natural disasters. That's why I'm introducing the Protecting Moms & Babies Against Climate Change Act to empower providers to protect parents, pregnant people, and babies.
